description: Aid groups say the photograph of Aylan Kurdi, the Syrian toddler who drowned, was a catalyst.
title: Donations for Refugees Surging, American Charities Report
title_page: Donations for Refugees Surging, American Charities Report - The New York Times
text:
Leading aid organizations in the United States are reporting a surge in charitable donations for helping refugees in the week since a photograph of a drowned Syrian toddler on a Turkish beach rocketed around social media worldwide.
The United States Fund for Unicef, for example, said that donations for the refugee response had gone up 636 percent, and that traffic to the organization’s website had tripled.
Save the Children, which has been working with victims of the Syria conflict for years, said it also had seen sharp increases in donations from ordinary Americans and new interest in helping from the organization’s longtime corporate benefactors.
“You see a dead child and can’t help but be catapulted into action,” said Caryl M. Stern, president and chief executive of the United States Fund for Unicef.
